title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
2 points:

  • One point is earned for stating one source of market failure is related to negative externality and for explaining that MSC>MPC.

  • One point is earned for stating one source of market failure is related to monopoly and for explaining that P>MR.
descriptions:
Student receives 0/2 Point(s)

2 points:

  • One point is earned for stating one source of market failure is related to negative externality and for explaining that MSC>MPC.

  • One point is earned for stating one source of market failure is related to monopoly and for explaining that P>MR.

Student receives 1/2 Point(s)

2 points:

  • One point is earned for stating one source of market failure is related to negative externality and for explaining that MSC>MPC.

  • One point is earned for stating one source of market failure is related to monopoly and for explaining that P>MR.

Student receives 2/2 Point(s)

2 points:

  • One point is earned for stating one source of market failure is related to negative externality and for explaining that MSC>MPC.

  • One point is earned for stating one source of market failure is related to monopoly and for explaining that P>MR.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point:

  • One point is earned for correctly identifying the profit-maximizing quantity is 150 units and the profit-maximizing price is $35.
descriptions:
Student receives 0/1 Point(s)

1 point:

  • One point is earned for correctly identifying the profit-maximizing quantity is 150 units and the profit-maximizing price is $35.

Student receives 1/1 Point(s)

1 point:

  • One point is earned for correctly identifying the profit-maximizing quantity is 150 units and the profit-maximizing price is $35.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point:

  • One point is earned for correctly identifying that with the tax the profit-maximizing quantity is 100 units and the profit-maximizing price is $40.
descriptions:
Student receives 0/1 Point(s)

1 point:

  • One point is earned for correctly identifying that with the tax the profit-maximizing quantity is 100 units and the profit-maximizing price is $40.

Student receives 1/1 Point(s)

1 point:

  • One point is earned for correctly identifying that with the tax the profit-maximizing quantity is 100 units and the profit-maximizing price is $40.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point:

  • One point is earned for stating that economic advisors would support no government intervention and for explaining using one of the following:

    • without intervention the firm would produce the socially efficient (optimal) quantity of 150 units.

    • without intervention the firm would produce a quantity of 150 units where the DWL is zero.

    • without intervention the firm would produce a quantity of 150 units where MSB=MSC.

    • with the tax intervention the firm would produce a quantity of 100 units where MSB>MSC.
descriptions:
